p: During the peak period of febrile seizure records (from April to July), enterovirus was the most frequent causative virus. Influenza virus infection was only most common in April, whereas enterovirus infection was most common from May to July ( Fig. 1). Rotavirus was prevalent from January to April, and RSV was prevalent in November and December. Adenovirus exhibited a consistent monthly distributional pattern throughout the year ( Table 3 ).
